Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens the safety, wellbeing, democracy, and economy of Australians.
Social media platforms already unjustly censor personal views and scientific knowledge.
The legislation could silence important truths and personal experiences.
There is a belief that differing truths exist based on individual experiences and spiritual beliefs.
Concerns about government overreach and potential hidden agendas.
Main Themes: Personal Experience with Social Media Censorship
Notable Quotes: Such changes in the law amendments propose a threat to the safety & wellbeing of Australians as well as our democracy society & economy.
I say, 'Who are you to define what is truth and what is untrue and make the decision to censor my truths over what you pertain to be your own truths.'
To silence truth is detrimental to society, to the individuals wellbeing in communities and those of their loved ones.
